question: My 86-year-old mother is currently hospitalized with a blood infection.  She has had Type II diabetes which is managed with medication, for a number of years.  She has some of other medical problems associated with diabetes (previous heartattack (13 years ago), slightly abnormal kidney function, PAD).  The doctors are unable to determine the source/origin of the blood infection but a CT scan has identified that her aorta is inflamed.  She is on a strong, broad spectrum antibiotic.  Does anyone have any knowledge, experience and/or experience regarding blood infection and/or inflamed aorta?Thank you
title: Bllod Infection and Inflamed Aorta
